subject: Re: [junit] Final Class (default accessibility) organization
msgSnippet: ... a) Organize test cases in the same package as the class under test b) Change the accessibility of the class under test Tag, you re it!   ;-) Mike -- Mike
messageBody:
idebug65 wrote:

> I have a class (a final class) which uses default accessibility. I
> would like to organize my test cases in a separate package/directory,
> but I'm having difficulty because I can not access my class.
> Currently, I have the unit test file soft linked into my production
> package, and this is working. But this can get messy when dealing
> with many files and packages. Is there a more graceful way of doing
> this?
>

a) Organize test cases in the same package as the class under test
b) Change the accessibility of the class under test


Tag, you're it! ;-)

Mike

--
Mike Clark
